data_exploration2 module¶

class data_exploration2.AsterixDataSource(host='localhost', port=19002)[source]¶
execute(_sql)[source]¶
data_exploration2.Correlation(col_pair, table_pair, key_pair)[source]¶
Correlation inputs columns/tables of interest, and required
keys to join tables, and returns a the correlation coefficient
Parameters:
  • col_pair – list or tuple of length 2. Contains two column names to calculate statistical function on
  • table_pair – list or tuple of length 2. Contains two table names which columns located in
  • key_pair – list or tuple of length 2. Values should be strings. Contains primary/foreign keys from table_pair
Returns:

float Correlation coefficient of the two variables
data_exploration2.Covariance(col_pair, table_pair, key_pair)[source]¶
Covariance inputs columns/tables of interest, and required
keys to join tables, and returns the covariance coefficient between two columns
Parameters:
  • col_pair – list or tuple of length 2. Contains two column names to calculate statistical function on
  • table_pair – list or tuple of length 2. Contains two table names which columns located in
  • key_pair – list or tuple of length 2. Values should be strings. Contains primary/foreign keys from table_pair
Returns:

float Covariance coefficient of the two variables
data_exploration2.Discontinue_Stocking(threshold, startyear, endyear)[source]¶
Discontinue_Stocking inputs a book sales threshold (minimum) and time frame, and returns categories whose
sales are below that threshold
Parameters:
  • threshold – int, minimum number of books needed to be sold during time period
  • startyear – int, start year. Function considers time after (not including) start year
  • endyear – int, end year. Function considers time up to and including end year
Returns:

list of dictionaries with only “Category” key and categoryID value
data_exploration2.Downward_Sales(season)[source]¶

Downward_Sales inputs a season and returns a list of dictionaries with SaleTrend and category keys

Parameters:season – str, season (summer, fall, winter, spring)
Returns:list of dictionaries with “SaleTrend” and “Category” keys
data_exploration2.GetTextAttributes(nodeIds=[1])[source]¶
data_exploration2.HighestMonthlySalesByCategory(category_list, limit)[source]¶

HighestMonthlySalesByCategory inputs a list of categories and limit and returns a dictionary of month/num_sold pairs

Parameters:
  • category_list – list, list of categories
  • limit – int, number of results per category to return
Returns:

list of dictionaries with “month” and “num_sold” keys
data_exploration2.Histogram(table, groupby, count)[source]¶

Histogram returns data for generating histograms in Postgres

Parameters:
  • table – str, table name
  • groupby – str, column to group by
  • count – str, column to be counted in the group by
Returns:

list of dictionaries, containing count and group keys
data_exploration2.OptimizedTopCategories(num_categories, months)[source]¶

OptimizedTopCategories inputs number of categories and months of interest and returns category and number of books from that category purchased in that time range

Parameters:
  • num_categories – int, number of categories to return
  • months – list, months
Returns:

list of tuples of each category and number of books purchased in month range
data_exploration2.Sales_Reviews(category, month)[source]¶
data_exploration2.Simpleagg(agg_func_pair, col_pair, table_pair, key_pair)[source]¶

Simpleagg allow you to input aggregation functions and columns and returns aggregated data from those columns :param agg_func_pair: list or tuple of length 2. Inputs should strings. Strings must be names of SQL aggregate

functions (count, max, sum, etc)
Parameters:
  • col_pair – list or tuple of length 2. Values should be strings. Two column names to calculate statistical function on
  • table_pair – list or tuple of length 2. Values should be strings.Table names which columns located in.
  • key_pair – list or tuple of length 2. Values should be strings. Contains primary/foreign keys from table_pair
Returns:

list of tuples, containing aggregations
data_exploration2.Stats(stat_func, col_pair, table_pair, key_pair)[source]¶
Stats function inputs SQL statistical functions (CORR, COV, etc.), columns/tables of interest, and required
keys to join tables, and returns a statistical value.
Parameters:
  • stat_func – str, SQL statistical function call (CORR, COV, etc.)
  • col_pair – list or tuple of length 2. Contains two column names to calculate statistical function on
  • table_pair – list or tuple of length 2. Contains two table names which columns located in
  • key_pair – list or tuple of length 2. Values should be strings. Contains primary/foreign keys from table_pair
Returns:

float Output of the statistical function
data_exploration2.convertToIn(_jlist)[source]¶

Helper function for HighestMonthlySalesByCategory

Parameters:_jlist – list, ints of nodeIDs
Returns:list, strings of nodeIDs
data_exploration2.getCategories()[source]¶

getCategories returns dictionary of categories

Returns:list of dictionaries of all categories with category as key
data_exploration2.getNodeIds(category_list)[source]¶

getNodeIds inputs a list of categories and returns a dictionary of category,nodeId pairs

Parameters:category_list – list, categories to get nodeIDs for
Returns:list of dictionaries of nodeIds as keys. Aggregated together (not separated by category)
data_exploration2.getTopCategories(limit)[source]¶

TopCategories returns top selling categories

Parameters:limit – int, number of categories to return
Returns:list of dictionaries of categories with category as key
